headline: 3rd Year EIE Students @ Imperial College London
summary: Interested in FPGA and hardware developemnt

jobPositions.title: Hardware Verification Intern
jobPositions.description: Worked under the systems team and responsible for creating component level UVM test benches for GICs(Generic Interrupt Controllers)
Currently working on developing hardware for fpgaConvNet
jobPositions.title: Undergraduate Research Assistance

projects.description:
As part of a team, performed the initial research phase into the viability of developing video frame-up conversion modules in hardware for the Intel FPGA team.

The project produced a literature review that serves as an introductory document to FRUC methods and also software simulation for those algorithms, a benchmarking suite and initial BRAM estimates for select algorithms.
projects.title: Video Interpolation for FPGAs
Verilog Visualiser and Simulator
projects.description: Worked as part of a team to create a Verilog Simulator, capable of producing block diagrams and waveform simulations; all packaged as a single VS code extension.

projects.title: C90 to MIPS Compiler
projects.description: Created a C90 to MIPS compiler using Lex for token generation, Yacc for token parsing, and C++ for the AST and assembly generation
Created a MIPS1 CPU simulator in C++.
projects.title: MIPS CPU Simulator
